a.h1: District Office Focusing on Kids and Their Learning

br.h3: For information about resources available to students and families, please click here:

div.p: TONIGHT IS THE NIGHT HAWKS!!!In honor of all College Place High School Seniors in the class of 2020, on Friday, April 17th at 8:20 PM (20:20 military time), the CPHS...
In honor of all College Place High School Seniors in the class of 2020, on Friday, April 17th at 8:20 PM (20:20 military time), the CPHS Stadium lights will turn on for 20...

img.alt: Schools Closed for Rest of School Year

a.span: Schools Closed for Rest of School Year

div.p: Governor Inslee announced that schools will be closed for in-person instruction for the remainder of the school year. However, Continuous Distance Learning will continue....

CPPS has partnered with PocketiNet to provide "Community Hot Spots" in the Davis Elementary upper parking lot and the CPHS Southside stadium parking lot. The wireless hotspot is called "Pocketinet-cpps". It is open to anyone in the community. Thank you PocketiNet!

Don't forget that we are continuing free meal pick up from 11:30 am -1:00 pm Monday- Friday at Sager and Davis. If you have specific food service needs please contact the District Office at 509-525-4827.

Schools will be closed for in-person instruction for the remainder of the school year. However, Continuous Distance Learning will continue. Read a statement from OSPI Superintendent Chris Reykdal: https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/WAOSPI/bulletins/2852f99​​​

Parents and Guardians - This is a reminder that there will be no meal service next week at CPPS, April 6-10 due to Spring Break. We have partnered with Walla Walla School District and meals will be available from 11 am -1 pm at Blueridge, Garrison and Prospect Point Schools.
So great to see our CPPS kids and families today!! Stay healthy and have a great spring break!!

District Office

The following employee has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights, Title IX and Section 504 Coordinator: James Fry, (509) 525-4827, jfry@cpps.org,1755 South College Avenue, College Place, Washington, 99324
